attributes.action: Weaken the deathly grip of party machines on the democratic life of the country by introducing legislation to: elect the House of Lords on a fixed term of three years by single transferable vote, which maximises choice for the elector; provide that no Member of the House of Lords may be a Minister of the Crown; allow the House of Lords to amend legislation and delay it for up to two years; give the House of Lords power to question all Ministers and require answers under pain of penalty; give the House of Lords power to impeach Ministers for misconduct; give the House of Lords the power on the decision of a two-thirds majority to dissolve the House of Commons no more than once every ten years and precipitate a General Election in the event of a deadlock between the two Houses.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The House of Commons is no longer properly representative of the country, and is controlled by the Executive through party machinery. The only hope of restoring confidence in democratic government is to create a powerful and independent Upper House that is able to call the Executive properly to account
